required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of the Safety and Performance of a Filler in Correction of Mid-face Age-related Volume Deficit
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Single Center Study for the Clinical Evaluation of the Safety and Performance of a Dermal Filler in Correction of Mid-face Age-related Volume Deficit

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective, single center study, on healthy subjects to evaluate the aesthetic improvement of facial volume, effect on the restoration and/or augmentation in subjects with mid-face age-related volume deficit after injection of a filler with lidocaine.

detailed_description.textblock: Prospective, non comparative, single center study, on healthy female subjects. The scope is to evaluate the performance and safety of a dermal filler (definisse core filler plus lidocaine) to evaluate the aesthetic improvement of facial volume, effect on the restoration and/or augmentation in subjects with mid-face age-related volume deficit after injection of a filler with lidocaine.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: prospective, non comparative single centre, on healthy subjects.

primary_outcome.time_frame: one month after injection (first visit from Day 0)
primary_outcome.description: Clinical evaluation of the global aesthetic improvement (GAIS) one month after injection of the investigational medical device in subjects with mid-face age-related volume deficit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global aesthetic improvement during follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical evaluation of the global aesthetic improvement (GAIS) 3, 6, 9, 12 and 18 months after injection of the investigational medical device in subjects with mid-face age-related volume deficit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical evaluation on restoration and/or augmentation of facial volume
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical evaluation of the investigational medical device effect on the restoration and/or augmentation of facial volume, with a clinical scale (FVLS) Face Volume Loss Scale, with a score from Grade 1 to Grade 5, when Grade 1 is the better outcome .
evaluation if a touch up injection is needed after one month

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective evaluation on restoration and/or augmentation of facial volume
secondary_outcome.description: Objective evaluation of the investigational medical device effect on the restoration and/or augmentation of facial volume, with cheekbone volume variation evaluation by 3D LifeVizÂ® system

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at each time point after injection, 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 9 months, 12 months and 18 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of subject satisfaction using a subjective evaluation questionnaire, (GAIS) Global Aesthetic improvement Scale, the scores is from 1 to 5, when 1 is the better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of injector satisfaction on using medical device
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the injection Day 0 and 1 one month after the first injection (Month 1)
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of injector satisfaction using a subjective evaluation questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: evaluation on skin quality after injection with Dermascan
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline (Day 0) to 3, 6, 9, 12 and 18 months after initial injection
secondary_outcome.description: Objective evaluation of the investigational medical device effect on skin quality using Dermascan instrument

secondary_outcome.measure: evaluation on skin thickness after injection with Dermascan
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline (Day 0) to 3, 6, 9, 12 and 18 months after initial injection
secondary_outcome.description: Objective evaluation of the investigational medical device effect on skin thickness using Dermascan instrument

secondary_outcome.measure: evaluation onskin biomechanical properties after injection with Cutometer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from baseline (Day 0) to 3, 6, 9, 12 and 18 months after initial injection
secondary_outcome.description: Objective evaluation of the investigational medical device effect on skin biomechanical properties measurements using Cutometer

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month after each injection for ISRs and 21 months for adverse event collection
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical evaluation of the investigational medical device safety with Injection Site Reactions (ISRs) and adverse event collection

arm_group.description: Cross linked sodium hyaluronate 25 mg/ml with 0,3% lidocaine hydrochloride will be inject during the first visit and a touch up after one month if indicated by the physician. The filler will inject in the face.

intervention.description: DEFINISSE CORE FILLER volume will be injected between 4.0 of 5.0 ml on the whole face (at the discretion of the treating physician to achieve an optimal aesthetic result). A touch-up will be possible at the first follow-up visit (after one month) with a amount of product between 4.0 and 5.0 ml on the whole face
